dimensions: plate (sheet trimmed to plate): 13.2 × 7.9 cm (5 3/16 × 3 1/8 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings:
Collector stamp in blue ink, verso lower right: Comte A. B. Lobanoff-Rostovsky (Lugt 2005)

Collector stamp in brown ink, verso lower left: Kupferstichkabinett der Staatlichen Museen (Lugt 1607)

Collector stamp in dark brown ink over previous stamp: Kupferstichkabinett der Staatlichen Museen (Lugt 234)

Collector stamp in black ink, verso lower left: Emil Schröter (Lugt 2270)
inscribed:
Inscribed and dated in plate, upper center: AETAT SUAE 64. Ao 1586

Signed in plate, lower right corner: HG.

Six lines in Latin and initials in margin below plate, lower center: Ceu viuum ut videas, ... in ære tibi. / N.F.A.

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Alexandre Borisovitch Lobanoff-Rostovsky [?-ca.1880, Lugt 2005]; sale of his collection, Berlin, April 26, 1881, lot 326; Kupferstichkabinett der Staatlichen Museen, Berlin [Lugt 1607]; deaccessioned in 1886 [Lugt 5997]; sale of the duplicates of the Kupferstichkabinett der Staatlichen Museen, Berlin, March 1, 1886, lot 243; Emil Schröter [?-1912, Lugt 2270]; sale of the collections of P.v. Baldinger-Seidenberg, Fritz Rumpf, and Emil Schröter, Stuttgart, May 7-11, 1912, lot 529; Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.
